sub_title: Assistant Professor at Delft University of Technology | Board Member of the Delft Young Academy | Member of the European Scientific and Technical Committee
summary:
The research activity of Angelo Accardo started in 2009 and involved several areas of investigation related to the nanotechnology and biomedical field. He has a strong background in microfabrication processes (e.g. optical lithography, stencil lithography, soft lithography, plasma reactive ion etch, 3D stereolithography, digital light projection, 2-photon absorption direct laser writing), computer aided design tools (e.g. AutoDesk Inventor), characterization tools (e.g. scanning electron microscopy, atomic force microscopy, confocal microscopy, Light sheet fluorescence microscopy, Small and Wide Angle X-ray Scattering, Raman and FTIR spectroscopy) and biology (neurodegenerative peptides, neuronal cells, cancer biomarkers, cancer cells, protein structures). 

Currently, He is Assistant Professor at Delft University of Technology (TU Delft). His main area of research is the development of multi-scale (nano-micro-meso) 3D fabrication paradigms to address a wide range of open questions in cell biology. He is interested in particular in the design and fabrication of 3D microenvironments, by employing light-assisted additive manufacturing techniques (such as two-photon lithography and stereolithography), for studying the mechanobiology, migration and differentiation mechanisms of mammalian cells as well as of spheroids/organoids.

Dr. Accardo is author of 41 publications in peer-reviewed journals (of which 23 as first/corresponding author, h-index=20), 4 book chapters (of which 2 as first author) and principal inventor of 1 industrial patent on electrowetting superhydrophobic surfaces. (Last update Nov 2021)

awards.title: University Teaching Qualification (Basis Kwalificatie Onderwijs, BKO)
NWO-ENW-XS grant for the project 3D engineered brain cancer microenvironments for proton radiobiology (PI, 50k, 2021).
NWO-ENW-M-2 grant for the project 3D cell-instructive engineered stem cell models for neuropsychiatric disorders (PI, 700k, 2021)
3mE Sectorplan Cohesion grant for the project “Bio-mimetic meta-implants” (PI, in collaboration with Mohammad Mirzaali, 200 k€)
1st Place grant of the TU Delft Health Initiative Pilot Projects for the project “3D Onco-Scaffolds as a benchmark tool for Proton Radiobiology” (10 k€)
Italian Scientific National Qualification (Abilitazione Scientifica Nazionale) as Associate professor in Experimental Physics (Section 02/B1, Fisica Sperimentale della Materia)
awards.issuer: Ministero dell'Istruzione, dell'Università e della Ricerca (Ministry of Education, Universities and Research)

awards.title: French National Qualification as Associate professor (N. 19228300504) in Physics and Materials Science (Qualification aux fonctions de Maître de Conférences, Section 28, Milieux denses et matériaux)

Front Cover of the journal "Materials Today" (Elsevier) for the paper "Direct laser fabrication of free-standing PEGDA-hydrogel scaffolds for neuronal cell growth: Engineering 3D biocompatible microenvironments" (2018).
Back Cover of the journal "Small" (Wiley) for the paper "Multiphoton Direct Laser Writing and 3D Imaging of Polymeric Freestanding Architectures for Cell Colonization" (2017).
Marie Sklodowska-Curie IF Seal of Excellence
60th Electron, Ion, and Photon Beam and Nanofabrication Conference (EIPBN 2016), Micro Nano Graph Contest Honorable Mention
41st International Conference on Micro and Nano Engineering 2015, Micro Nano Graph Contest Honorable Mention
Best Poster Award at the 41st International Conference on Micro and Nano Engineering MNE 2015, The Hague, The Netherlands
Front cover of the journal "Particle" (Wiley) for the paper "Nanocrystal self-assembly into hollow dome-shaped microstructures by slow solvent evaporation on superhydrophobic substrates" (2015).
39th International Conference on Micro and Nano Engineering 2013, Micro Nano Graph Contest 1st Prize
Back cover of the journal "Soft Matter" (RSC) for the paper "Lysozyme fibrillation induced by convective flows under quasi contact-free conditions" (2011).
NWO-ENW-M-2 grant for the project 3D cell-instructive engineered stem cell models for neuropsychiatric disorders (PI, 700k, 2021)

profile_positions.title: Member of the Scientific Steering Committee

profile_positions.description:
Tenure-Track Assistant Professor  
Faculty of Mechanical, Maritime and Materials Engineering (3mE) 
Department of Precision and Microsystems Engineering (PME) 

Development of multi-scale (nano-micro-meso) 3D fabrication paradigms to address a wide range of open questions in cell biology. Design and fabrication of 3D microenvironments, by employing light-assisted additive manufacturing techniques (such as two-photon lithography and stereolithography), for studying the mechanobiology, migration and differentiation mechanisms of cells as well as of spheroids/organoids.
profile_positions.title: Tenure-Track Assistant Professor (Universitair Docent 2 - UD2)
Member of the European Scientific and Technical Committee

profile_positions.description: Editorial Board Member of the Journals Frontiers in Biomaterials Science, Frontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology
profile_positions.title: Editorial Board Member

profile_positions.description: Editorial Board Member of the Journal Micromachines
profile_positions.title: Editorial Board Member

profile_positions.description:
Research Associate in the context of several collaborations between the Engineering in Life Sciences Applications - ELiA team of LAAS-CNRS, the Institut national de la santé et de la recherche médicale (INSERM, Units 1214 and 1048), the CRCT (Cancer Research Center of Toulouse) and the STROMALab.
Development and characterization of 3D architectures for the study of cell growth/proliferation by means of additive manufacturing techniques and 3D imaging approaches.
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

profile_positions.description: Realization of nanostructured architectures for the characterization of breast cancer biomarkers (estrogen receptors) at the Institut des Maladies Métaboliques et Cardiovasculaires (I2MC) UMR 1048 of INSERM in collaboration with the Laboratoire d'analyse et d'architectures des systèmes LAAS-CNRS.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: Realization of nanostructured supports coupled to X-ray diffraction and spectroscopy (Raman, FTIR) for the investigation of biomedical relevant subjects (e.g. neurodegenerative peptides, cancer vesicles, biomineralization)
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: PhD Student at the ID13 Microfocus Beamline, Structure of Soft Matter Group. Integration of biomimetic superhydrophobic surfaces in the context synchrotron radiation analysis of droplets loaded with biocompounds (e.g. proteins, enzymes, synthetic peptides).
profile_positions.title: PhD Student

volunteer_experiences.description: Organization and leading of visits of the facility to scientific and general public audiences.
